item.title: 90pc voters willing to participate in national polls: CRF Survey
item.description:
About 90 per cent of voters have expressed their willingness to participate in the upcoming 13th national parliamentary election, according to a survey conducted by the Communication and Research Foundation (CRF).
The findings were revealed on Wednesday at the National Press Club during the rele

item.title: EC to postpone Sherpur-3 election following Jamaat candidate’s death
item.description: Election in the Sherpur-3 (Sreebardi–Jhenaigati) constituency is set to be postponed following the death of Jamaat-e-Islami–nominated candidate and district Jamaat secretary Nuruzzaman Badal, 51. Under election laws, voting in a constituency must be suspended if a valid candidate dies.

item.title: US-Iran drone incident raises fresh doubts over planned talks
item.description: A tense aerial encounter between the United States and Iran on Tuesday has cast uncertainty over the prospects of upcoming talks between the two rivals. item.title: Schoolboy killed in Narsingdi clash
item.description: A 14-year-old school student was shot dead in a clash between rival groups over establishing dominance in the Saidabad area in Raipura upazila of Narsingdi district on Wednesday. The deceased was identified as Mustakim Mia, reports UNB. Police and local sources said rivalry between two local grou

item.title: BNP to make women self-reliant if voted to power: Tarique
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman on Wednesday said women would be made self-reliant if his party is voted to power in the national election. While addressing a rally at Bell’s Park in Barishal city, he said mothers and daughters would receive primary healthcare services at home, without needing t

item.title: Fakhrul accuses Jamaat-e-Islami of ‘deceiving’ voters with religious claims
item.description: BNP Secretary General Mirza Fakhrul Islam Alamgir has accused Jamaat-e-Islami of deceiving people by invoking religion in electoral politics, saying claims that voting for a particular symbol guarantees heaven amount to outright falsehoods. The sheaf of paddy candidate for Thakurgaon-1 raised thes

item.title: Midland Bank inaugurates its Jashore Branch
item.description: Midland Bank PLC (MDB) formally inaugurated its Jashore Branch at R N Road, Jashore Sadar on February 2, 2026. Md. Ahsan-uz Zaman, Managing Director & CEO of the bank, inaugurated the Branch as Chief Guest along with Md. Rashed Akter, Head of Retail Distribution Division, Branch Manager of Jashore

item.title: India's Modi praised for US trade deal as opposition questions impact on agriculture
item.description: Indian lawmakers from the ruling coalition praised Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Tuesday for striking a deal with the U.S. that seeks to reduce tariffs on Indian goods, while the opposition raised questions on the impact on sensitive sectors such as agriculture. President Donald Trump on Monday

item.title: BNP committed to ensuring full media freedom: Salahuddin Ahmed
item.description: Bangladesh Nationalist Party (BNP) Standing Committee Member Salahuddin Ahmed today said his party is committed to ensuring complete freedom of the media, as outlined in BNP's 31-point reform agenda. He said BNP has pledged to form a separate media reform commission and will take necessary measure

item.title: Memories of vote: How it feels returning to the ballot
item.description: On a February evening in Dhaka, Neza Mahmud, a young, promising lawyer, is planning a journey she once thought she might never make again. The journey is not to a vacation where physical presence is needed, but to something more ideological, mental, and self-expression; it is about voting in the el

item.title: New oppressors have emerged, says Tarique Rahman
item.description: BNP Chairman Tarique Rahman has called on voters to be wary of Jamaat-e-Islami, referring to it as a “secret organisation”. He said, "The people of this secret organisation have emerged as new oppressors of the people of Bangladesh." The BNP chief made these remarks at a party rally a

item.title: BNP complains of election officer appointment from ‘Jamaat school’
item.description: At least 14 teachers from an unregistered educational institution “run with the patronage of Jamaat-e-Islami” have been appointed as election officials in Sunamganj’s Tahirpur for the 13th parliamentary election, BNP has complained. Tahirpur Upazila Nirbahi Officer (UNO) and Assi
